info.description: Manage lifecycle of your Cloud resources using Resource Controller APIs. Resources are provisioned globally in an account scope. Supports asynchronous provisioning of resources. Enables consumption of a global resource through a Cloud Foundry space in any region.
info.title: IBM Cloud Resource Controller API

get.summary: Get a list of all resource aliases
get.description: Get a list of all resource aliases.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Short ID of the alias.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the alias.

parameters.name: resource_instance_id
parameters.description: Resource instance short ID.

parameters.name: region_instance_id
parameters.description: Short ID of the instance in a specific targeted environment. For example, `service_instance_id` in a given IBM Cloud environment.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the offering (service name). This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

parameters.name: resource_group_id
parameters.description: Short ID of Resource group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on how many items should be returned.

200.description: The list of aliases was successfully retrieved.

post.description: Alias a resource instance into a targeted environment's (name)space.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The short or long ID of the alias.

get.description: Retrieve a resource alias by ID.

delete.description: Delete a resource alias by ID.

patch.description: Update a resource alias by ID.

get.summary: Get a list of all resource bindings
get.description: Get a list of all resource bindings.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: The short ID of the binding.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the binding.

parameters.name: resource_group_id
parameters.description: Short ID of the resource group.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the offering (service name). This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

parameters.name: region_binding_id
parameters.description: Short ID of the binding in the specific targeted environment, e.g. service_binding_id in a given IBM Cloud environment.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on how many items should be returned

200.description: The list of resource bindings was successfully retrieved.

parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieve a resource binding by ID.

credentials.iam_apikey_description: Auto generated apikey during resource-bind operation for Instance - crn:v1:bluemix:public:cloud-object-storage:global:a/4329073d16d2f3663f74bfa955259139:8d7af921-b136-4078-9666-081bd8470d94::

get.summary: Get a list of all resource instances
get.description: Get a list of all resource instances.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: When you provision a new resource in the specified location for the selected plan, a GUID (globally unique identifier) is created. This is a unique internal GUID managed by Resource controller that corresponds to the instance.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the instance.

parameters.name: resource_group_id
parameters.description: Short ID of a resource group.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

parameters.name: resource_plan_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the plan associated with the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the instance. For example, `service_instance`.

parameters.name: sub_type
parameters.description: The sub-type of instance, e.g. `cfaas`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on how many items should be returned.

200.description: The list of resource instances was successfully retrieved.

post.description: Provision a new resource in the specified location for the selected plan.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

202.description: Request to provision a resource has been accepted.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The short or long ID of the instance.

get.description: Retrieve a resource instance by ID.

200.description: The resource instance was successfully retrieved.

delete.description: Delete a resource instance by ID.

patch.description: Update a resource instance by ID.

200.description: The requested changes have been applied

202.description: Request to update a resource instance has been accepted

get.summary: Get a list of resource keys

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: When you create a new key, a GUID (globally unique identifier) is assigned. This is a unique internal GUID managed by Resource controller that corresponds to the key.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the key.

parameters.name: resource_group_id
parameters.description: The short ID of the resource group.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit on how many items should be returned.

200.description: The list of resource keys was successfully retrieved.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value should use the format Bearer [token] - where [token] is an opaque access token obtained by authenticating with IAM authentication services.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The short or long ID of the key.

200.description: The resource key was successfully retrieved.

credentials.iam_apikey_description: Auto generated apikey during resource-key operation for Instance - crn:v1:bluemix:public:cloud-object-storage:global:a/4329073d16d2f3663f74bfa955259139:8d7af921-b136-4078-9666-081bd8470d94::

patch.description: Update a resource key by ID.

200.description: The resource key was successfully updated.

credentials.iam_apikey_description: Auto generated apikey during resource-key operation for Instance - crn:v1:bluemix:public:cloud-object-storage:global:a/4329073d16d2f3663f74bfa955259139:8d7af921-b136-4078-9666-081bd8470d94::

BadRequest.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax.

Unauthorized.description: Your access token is invalid or authenication of your token failed.

Forbidden.description: Your access token is valid but does not have the necessary permissions to access this resource.

NotFound.description: The resource could not be found.

Gone.description: The resource could was previously deleted and is no longer available.

UnprocessableEntity.description: The request could not be processed.

TooManyRequests.description: Too many requests. Please wait a few minutes and try again.

InternalServerError.description: Your request could not be processed. Please try again later. If the problem persists, note the `transaction-id` in the response header and contact [IBM Cloud support](https://watson.service-now.com/wcp).

ErrorReport.description: Description of an error that occurred in a service request.

ResourceInstancePatch.description: Updated property values for a resource instance.

name.description: The new name of the instance. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

parameters.description: The new configuration options for the instance.

resource_plan_id.description: The unique ID of the plan associated with the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

ResourceAliasPatch.description: Updated property values for a resource alias.

name.description: The new name of the alias. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

ResourceAliasPost.description: Property values for the new resource alias.

name.description: The name of the alias. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

source.description: The short or long ID of resource instance.

target.description: The CRN of target name(space) in a specific environment, e.g. space in Dallas YP, CFEE instance etc.

ResourceBindingPost.description: Property values for the new resource binding.

name.description: The name of the binding. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

source.description: The short or long ID of resource alias.

target.description: The CRN of application to bind to in a specific environment, e.g. Dallas YP, CFEE instance

parameters.description: Configuration options represented as key-value pairs that are passed through to the target resource brokers.

role.description: The role name or it's CRN.

ResourceBindingPatch.description: Updated property values for the resource binding.

name.description: The new name of the binding. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

ResourceInstancePost.description: Property values for the new resource instance.

name.description: The name of the instance. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

target.description: The deployment location where the instance should be hosted.

resource_group.description: Short or long ID of resource group

resource_plan_id.description: The unique ID of the plan associated with the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

tags.description: Tags that are attached to the instance after provisioning. These tags can be searched and managed through the Tagging API in IBM Cloud.

parameters.description: Configuration options represented as key-value pairs that are passed through to the target resource brokers.

ResourceKeyPatch.description: Updated property values for the resource key.

name.description: The new name of the key. Must be 180 characters or less and cannot include any special characters other than `(space) - . _ :`.

ResourceKeyPost.description: Property values for the new resource key.

source.description: The short or long ID of resource instance or alias.

parameters.description: Configuration options represented as key-value pairs that are passed through to the target resource brokers.

role.description: The role name or it's CRN.

id.description: The ID associated with the instance.

guid.description: When you create a new resource, a globally unique identifier (GUID) is assigned. This GUID is a unique internal identifier managed by the resource controller that corresponds to the instance.

crn.description: The full Cloud Resource Name (CRN) associated with the instance. For more information about this format, see [Cloud Resource Names](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/overview?topic=overview-crn).

url.description: When you provision a new resource, a relative URL path is created identifying the location of the instance.

name.description: The human-readable name of the instance.

account_id.description: An alpha-numeric value identifying the account ID.

resource_group_id.description: The short ID of the resource group.

resource_group_crn.description: The long ID (full CRN) of the resource group.

resource_id.description: The unique ID of the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

resource_plan_id.description: The unique ID of the plan associated with the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

target_crn.description: The full deployment CRN as defined in the global catalog. The Cloud Resource Name (CRN) of the deployment location where the instance is provisioned.

state.description: The current state of the instance. For example, if the instance is deleted, it will return removed.

type.description: The type of the instance, e.g. `service_instance`.

last_operation.description: The status of the last operation requested on the instance.

dashboard_url.description: The resource-broker-provided URL to access administrative features of the instance.

plan_history.description: The plan history of the instance.

resource_aliases_url.description: The relative path to the resource aliases for the instance.

resource_bindings_url.description: The relative path to the resource bindings for the instance.

resource_keys_url.description: The relative path to the resource keys for the instance.

created_at.description: The date when the instance was created.

updated_at.description: The date when the instance was last updated.

deleted_at.description: The date when the instance was deleted.

PlanHistoryItem.description: An element of the plan history of the instance.

resource_plan_id.description: The unique ID of the plan associated with the offering. This value is provided by and stored in the global catalog.

start_date.description: The date on which the plan was changed.

next_url.description: The URL for requesting the next page of results.

rows_count.description: The number of resource instances in `resources`.

id.description: The ID associated with the alias.

guid.description: When you create a new alias, a globally unique identifier (GUID) is assigned. This GUID is a unique internal indentifier managed by the resource controller that corresponds to the alias.

crn.description: The full Cloud Resource Name (CRN) associated with the alias. For more information about this format, see [Cloud Resource Names](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/overview?topic=overview-crn).

url.description: When you created a new alias, a relative URL path is created identifying the location of the alias.

name.description: The human-readable name of the alias.

account_id.description: An alpha-numeric value identifying the account ID.

resource_group_id.description: The short ID of the resource group.

resource_group_crn.description: The long ID (full CRN) of the resource group.

target_crn.description: The CRN of the target namespace in the specific environment.

resource_instance_id.description: The short ID of the resource instance that is being aliased.

region_instance_id.description: The short ID of the instance in the specific target environment, e.g. `service_instance_id` in a given IBM Cloud environment.

resource_instance_url.description: The relative path to the instance.

resource_bindings_url.description: The relative path to the resource bindings for the alias.

resource_keys_url.description: The relative path to the resource keys for the alias.

created_at.description: The date when the alias was created.

updated_at.description: The date when the alias was last updated.

deleted_at.description: The date when the alias was deleted.

next_url.description: The URL for requesting the next page of results.

rows_count.description: The number of resource aliases in `resources`.

id.description: The ID associated with the binding.

guid.description: When you create a new binding, a globally unique identifier (GUID) is assigned. This GUID is a unique internal identifier managed by the resource controller that corresponds to the binding.

crn.description: The full Cloud Resource Name (CRN) associated with the binding. For more information about this format, see [Cloud Resource Names](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/overview?topic=overview-crn).

url.description: When you provision a new binding, a relative URL path is created identifying the location of the binding.

name.description: The human-readable name of the binding.

account_id.description: An alpha-numeric value identifying the account ID.

resource_group_id.description: The short ID of the resource group.

source_crn.description: The CRN of resource alias associated to the binding.

target_crn.description: The CRN of target resource, e.g. application, in a specific environment.

region_binding_id.description: The short ID of the binding in specific targeted environment, e.g. `service_binding_id` in a given IBM Cloud environment.

credentials.description: The credentials for the binding. Additional key-value pairs are passed through from the resource brokers.  For additional details, see the service’s documentation.

iam_compatible.description: Specifies whether the binding’s credentials support IAM.

resource_alias_url.description: The relative path to the resource alias that this binding is associated with.

created_at.description: The date when the binding was created.

updated_at.description: The date when the binding was last updated.

deleted_at.description: The date when the binding was deleted.

next_url.description: The URL for requesting the next page of results.

rows_count.description: The number of resource bindings in `resources`.

id.description: The ID associated with the key.

guid.description: When you create a new key, a globally unique identifier (GUID) is assigned. This GUID is a unique internal identifier managed by the resource controller that corresponds to the key.

crn.description: The full Cloud Resource Name (CRN) associated with the key. For more information about this format, see [Cloud Resource Names](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/overview?topic=overview-crn).

url.description: When you created a new key, a relative URL path is created identifying the location of the key.

name.description: The human-readable name of the key.

account_id.description: An alpha-numeric value identifying the account ID.

resource_group_id.description: The short ID of the resource group.

source_crn.description: The CRN of resource instance or alias associated to the key.

credentials.description: The credentials for the key. Additional key-value pairs are passed through from the resource brokers.  Refer to service’s documentation for additional details.

iam_compatible.description: Specifies whether the key’s credentials support IAM.

resource_instance_url.description: The relative path to the resource.

created_at.description: The date when the key was created.

updated_at.description: The date when the key was last updated.

deleted_at.description: The date when the key was deleted.

next_url.description: The URL for requesting the next page of results.

rows_count.description: The number of resource keys in `resources`.

apikey.description: The API key for the credentials.

iam_apikey_description.description: The optional description of the API key.

iam_apikey_name.description: The name of the API key.

iam_role_crn.description: The Cloud Resource Name for the role of the credentials.

iam_serviceid_crn.description: The Cloud Resource Name for the service ID of the credentials.

additionalProperties.description: Additional key-value pairs from the resource broker.
